intro: Sanguisorba vulgaris subvar. magnolii, commonly known as the white sorrel, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
